testCases.explanation: Each digit is distinct, the minimum subarray of length 1 has distinct-sum >= 1.

All digits are 1; to get distinct sum >= 1, the minimum window needs all 4 (or just 1 since digit 1 appears once in any window of length 1). Actually any single char gives distinct sum = 1. So answer is 1.
Both characters are distinct; minimum subarray with both distinct chars has length 2.
Minimum window containing all distinct characters a,b,c is length 3.
Single character, minimum subarray is the whole string of length 1.

description: Given a string `s`, find the minimum length subarray (substring) such that the sum of distinct character values (a=1, b=2, ...) is at least k. Return the minimum length, or -1 if no such subarray exists.

examples.explanation: Minimum window with all distinct characters has length 3.

constraints: s consists of lowercase English letters or digit characters
